basics.name: Ishita Chaturvedi
basics.designation: Computer Science PhD student at Princeton University

work.name: Liberty Research Group, Princeton University
highlights: Working on optimizing high thread count SMT on CPUs for data center workloads.
Developed lightweight, hardware-only out-of-order execution for GPUs.
Worked on GPU warp scheduling to improve kernel performance.
Led a project to understand stall profiling in GPUs and developed a GPU profiler to report the percentage speedup obtained by removing different stall types.

work.name: Microsoft Research, Seattle
highlights: Worked on memory disaggregation on the Azure data-center to improve hardware resource utilization.

work.name: Simyog Technology, Bangalore
highlights: Worked on expediting code by hardware-based acceleration methods such as cache optimization and Vectorization.
Achieved a speedup of 6x on major code bottlenecks and a full flow speedup of 2x.

work.name: National Centre for Radio Astrophysics, Pune
work.position: National Initiative for Undergraduate Science Fellow
highlights: Developed and optimized a Real-Time Radio Transient detecting pipeline in CUDA and C++ to be integrated into the Giant Meter Wave Radio Telescope Facility.

awards.title: National Initiative on Undergraduate Science Fellow

Skills.Programming Languages: C++, C, Python, CUDA, Java, Verilog, Assembly, LaTeX, HTML
Skills.Working Environment: Linux Shel, Git, SVN, Tmux, Vim
